ygData.subject: **SPOILER**Re: Research & Langauges**SPOILER**
ygData.msgSnippet: I bought a book in, of all places Kaladim that spoke about spell research and more importantly the languages that are needed. Lower level spells will be
ygData.messageBody:
I bought a book in, of all places Kaladim that spoke about spell research
and more importantly the languages that are needed.
Lower level spells will be written in Old Erudian. Older than that you have
Combine. That great human empire that was wiped out
by the dragon incursions of the great wurm queen. Finally, there is Elder
Dragon. The language of magic itself. I'm guessing that
we won't be able to get these right away... : )

Zalbar
15th Wizard
Solusek Ro

-----Original Message-----
From: John Penman <jpenman@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: 27 avril, 1999 11:02
Subject: [eq_wizards] Additional Notes on Research & Langauges


>From: "John Penman" <jpenman@...>
>
>Well I thought I had it all finished, I have maxed out my Old Erudian so I
>can read the Cannon of Wizzadry (which I can), and decided to buy the next
>book Doctorine of Wizzadry thinking I could read it as well. WRONG. It
>seems to be written in a new langauge, which is unfortunate because I have
a
>few languages with just Feeble skill, thus why I can only read part of the
>book. If anyone out there knows what language this one is written in, I
>would greatly appreciate this info.
>
>Now for new languages, I have been completely trained in Barbarian and
>Gnomish last night and half training in Lizardman (I like this one).
>Getting Kobold tonight, so if you have a language that you are willing to
>trade for one of mine please give me a tell.
>
>Shadair
>15th Wizzard of Nerriak
>Karana
>
